questions.question_text: A technician is troubleshooting a projector that will not display any images. The technician has verified the computer output and cable are providing a good video signal. Which of the following should the technician do NEXT?

discussion.content:
I think C
The MOST efficient next step the technician should do is to test the output resolution1. The issue of a projector that will not display any images could be related to the output resolution1. If the output resolution is not compatible with the projector, the projector will not display any images1. Calibrating the image, replacing the bulb, or cleaning the fans may not be effective1.
If a projector is not displaying any images despite verifying that the computer output and cable are providing a good video signal, the technician should test the output resolution. The output resolution of the computer may not be compatible with the projector, which can cause the projector to not display any images.

Selected Answer: B
The projector will not display ANY images because there is no light (bulb is burned). If the resolution is off then the quality of the image will be less than optimal but you should see something. Resolution will be in 1K instead of 4K for example.

comments.content: Please explain why the answer is C?

discussion.content: The answer is C

Selected Answer: B
Answer is B

Selected Answer: B
The NEXT step the technician should take when troubleshooting a projector that will not display any images, even after verifying the computer output and cable, is:

B. Replace the bulb.

Explanation:

Projectors use bulbs (or lamps) to produce the light needed for image projection. If the bulb is faulty or has reached the end of its lifespan, it can result in a lack of image display.
Answer is B

Selected Answer: C
The correct is C

Selected Answer: BE
The answer seem correct to me and Chatgpt agree 
To troubleshoot the issue of a Windows computer running slowly and experiencing intermittent timeouts after the installation of a CAD program, the technician should consider the following steps:

Research the requirements of the application (Option B):

Check if the CAD program has specific system requirements, both in terms of hardware and software. Ensure that the computer meets or exceeds these requirements. If the system falls short, it might struggle to run the application smoothly.
Check the Event Viewer logs (Option E):

The Event Viewer logs can provide valuable information about system events, errors, and warnings. Look for any error messages or patterns that coincide with the slowdowns. This can help identify specific issues or error codes related to the CAD program or other system components.

BE
The technician should research the requirements of the CAD program to see if the computer meets them or needs any upgrades or updates to run it properly. The technician should also check the Event Viewer logs to see if there are any errors or warnings related to the application or system performance that could indicate the cause of the problem or suggest a solution. Reference: https://www.comptia.org/training/books/a-core-1-220- 1101-study-guide (pages 43, 47

questions.question_text: A user's Windows computer started running slowly after the installation of a CAD program. The computer has intermittent timeouts and often has to be rebooted to restore functionality. The computer seems to work correctly if the application is not running. Which of the following should the technician do NEXT to help troubleshoot the issue? (Choose two.)

choices.B: Research the requirements of the application.

questions.question_text:
A user's device needs more memory, so a technician installs extra RAM with the following specifications:

2 x 8Gb DDR3-1066 (PC3-8500)
1 x 16Gb DDR3-1333 (PC3-10600)

Which of the following speeds would maximize reliability?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
I might be misunderstanding question, but it is recommended to use the same speed memory. All memory will only run at speed of the slowest modules which is 1066. I think answer should be A. 1066

comments.content: You understand it just fine. Nice job

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. 1,333
When installing RAM modules with different specifications, the system will typically operate at the speed of the slowest module. In this case, the slowest module is the 8GB DDR3-1066 (PC3-8500), which has a speed of 1,066 MHz. Therefore, to maximize reliability, the system should be configured to operate at the speed of 1,333 MHz, which corresponds to the 16GB DDR3-1333 (PC3-10600) module.

comments.content: I am sorry, but no. You want the two RAM modules to run at the lowest common speed, in which is A.1066 MHz

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
In a scenario where multiple RAM modules with different speeds are installed, the system tends to operate at the speed of the slowest module to ensure compatibility and stability. In this case, the DDR3-1066 (PC3-8500) module is the slowest among the installed RAM.

So, the speed that would maximize reliability is:

A. 1,066
I am going with A

comments.content: You use the RAM module with the lowest common speed, and since 1066MHz is the lowest; you will choose that.
What is your reasoning for Answer A ??

discussion.content: I think A is the answer: Matching the slowest RAM module: When installing different RAM modules with different speeds, the system will typically operate at the speed of the slowest module. This is done to ensure compatibility and stability.

Selected Answer: C
C. Ask the user about the symptoms the computer is experiencing.

Explanation:

Before taking any specific actions, it's crucial to gather information about the reported issue. Asking the user about the symptoms the computer is experiencing can provide valuable insights into the nature of the problem. This initial step helps the technician understand the user's perspective, gather details about the issue, and potentially identify whether the reported problem is indeed related to a virus or another issue.

Selected Answer: C
I believe the answer should be C

Selected Answer: C
Before taking any action to resolve the reported virus issue, the technician should gather more information about the problem from the user. Asking the user about the symptoms the computer is experiencing can provide critical insights into the nature and behavior of the suspected virus. Some important information to gather includes:

Specific error messages or warning signs the user encountered.
Any unusual behavior of the computer (e.g., slow performance, unexpected pop-ups, crashes).
When the issue first started and any recent changes or activities on the computer.
Any websites visited or software installed recently that might be related to the infection.
Understanding the symptoms and potential sources of the infection will help the technician formulate an effective plan of action to resolve the problem. It also allows the technician to determine if further investigation is needed or if running antivirus software (Option B) immediately is a suitable step based on the information provided by the user

Selected Answer: C
The FIRST step the technician should take when a user reports a computer virus is option C: Ask the user about the symptoms the computer is experiencing. By gathering information about the symptoms, the technician can better understand the nature of the virus infection and its potential impact on the system. This information will help the technician determine the appropriate plan of action to resolve the problem effectively. It is essential to have a clear understanding of the situation before proceeding with any specific actions like running antivirus software or making backups.

Selected Answer: C
Running antivirus is a real world simple check and solution. Comptia troubleshooting steps want you to not assume user is correct though. Step 1. Identify issue - ask questions and identify symptoms.
C. Ask the user about the symptoms the computer is experiencing.

questions.question_text: A user reports that a computer has a virus on it. Which of the following is the FIRST step the technician should take?

choices.C: Ask the user about the symptoms the computer is experiencing.
choices.A: Determine a plan of action to resolve the problem.
choices.B: Run antivirus software to remove the virus from the computer.
choices.D: Make a backup of the user's data on an external drive.

questions.question_text: A user lost a wallet containing credit and debit cards and is unable to purchase merchandise. Which of the following mobile phone technologies would allow the user to complete transactions?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Is correct

Near Field Communication (NFC) is correct. It is a standard two-way radio communication that occurs over short distances of about 4 inches. Used for contactless payment and similar technologies. This definition is coming straight out of the CompTia A+ book.
